Hero.title: Free, confidential support from a helpline or hotline near you. Online chat, text or phone.
Hero.text-2: Using a helpline: What to expect

Partners.title: Key Partners

cards.card-1-info: Connect with a helpline for support today.
cards.card-2-info: Get support from a trained volunteer, counselor or peer.
cards.card-3-info: Feel comfortable to share what’s on your mind.

Partners.aloneTitle: You don’t have to go through this alone.
Partners.aloneSubtitle: If you are struggling today, need support with your mental health, or have experienced a traumatic event, consider contacting a helpline. It’s free, anonymous and confidential.
Partners.helplineConceptText-1: Helplines (also known as hotlines or crisis lines) provide immediate crisis counseling, emotional support and information – for free.
Partners.helplineConceptText-2: Most helpline phone numbers are toll-free and many helplines are available over text message or online chat. Helplines are often available 24/7, so you can contact them at any time of the day or night.
Partners.helplineConceptSupport: How will a helpline support me?
Partners.helplineConceptSupportText-1: Helplines provide a judgment-free space for you to talk through difficult emotions and experiences, receive support, and connect to other resources that can help you.
Partners.helplineConceptSupportText-2: Talking helps, and research has shown that people feel less distressed after contacting helplines.
Partners.talkTohelpleAbout: What can I talk to a helpline about?
Partners.talkTohelpleAboutText-1: The most common types of helpline are suicide prevention hotlines, domestic violence hotlines and sexual assault hotlines.
Partners.talkTohelpleAboutText-2: However, helplines are available for a wide range of mental health and emotional struggles including anxiety, depression, gender or sexual identity, substance use and much more.
Partners.talkTohelpleAboutText-3: You don't have to be suicidal or in a severe situation to contact a helpline. You might just need to talk, or want information on supporting others.
Partners.findHelpline: How do I find the best helpline for me?
Partners.findHelplineText-1: In some countries, many helplines are available. For example, if you live in the United States, popular nationwide helplines are the 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline, Crisis Text Line and TrevorLifeline.
Partners.findHelplineText-2: When you search for a helpline on Find A Helpline, our intelligent ranking algorithm will recommend the best helplines for you.
Partners.findHelplineText-3: You can also further filter according to your needs, and read helpline descriptions to learn more about the service each helpline provides.
Partners.findHelplineText-4: Because helplines are free, you can contact more than one service to find the right one for you.

helpline-and-Country.title: We partner with verified helplines in 130+ countries
helpline-and-Country.InfoText-1: Find A Helpline is powered by ThroughLine, the largest, most accurate helpline resource in the world.
helpline-and-Country.InfoText-2: We hold relationships with helpline organisations and crisis centers in over 130 countries, who verify their information with us directly.
helpline-and-Country.InfoText-3: Other services and websites provide long lists of out-of-date information, but we work daily to keep our information accurate and easy to use – both for the people who need immediate support and for the partners who rely on us.
helpline-and-Country.OtherServicesText-3: Difficult to find the right service

ReasonToContact.title: Common reasons for contacting a helpline
ReasonToContact.text-1: Unsure if contacting a helpline is right for you? Here are some reasons other people have sought free, confidential support from a helpline or hotline:

li.li-1: Experiencing a suicidal crisis, such as thinking “I want to die” or about how to kill yourself, or wanting support after attempting to take your life.
li.li-2: Experiencing domestic abuse or violence, sexual abuse, depression, anxiety, or other emotional distress.
li.li-3: Struggling with self-harm, an addiction or substance use challenge, your body image or an eating disorder.
li.li-4: Noticing warning signs in a loved one, feeling concerned someone may be at risk of hurting themselves, or wanting to know how to help someone you’re worried about.
li.li-5: Wanting to learn about mental health crisis services, suicide prevention, general mental health services and resources.
li.li-6: Just simply thinking “I need help” and not knowing where to start.

Companies.title: For Businesses & Organizations
Companies.scaling: Scaling & maintaining global support resources is challenging & costly. We make it easy.
Companies.text-1: Find A Helpline is a public service by ThroughLine. It's part of our mission to ease every emotional crisis, globally.
Companies.text-2: ThroughLine empowers online communities and platforms to protect their users and brand reputation through verified crisis support resources.

Footer.title-1: Find A Helpline is a public service made with ♡ by

Faqs.title: What to expect when you contact a helpline

intro.p1: Reaching out for help is one of the bravest—and hardest—things you can do when you're struggling.
intro.p2: Helplines — also known as crisis lines, support hotlines, or emotional support call centers — offer immediate emotional support to people around the world.
intro.p3: If you're used to keeping things to yourself or have never contacted a helpline before, you might not know what to expect. That uncertainty can add extra stress to an already difficult situation.
intro.p4: For some people, knowing what to expect can relieve that stress and make it easier to seek help.
intro.p5: Here are some answers to frequently asked questions:

title-1.q: Who will I be talking to?

a.p1: In most cases, you'll have one of three types of people on the other end of a helpline:
a.p2: Volunteers – people with some training in how to listen and help. They are not paid for their work.
a.p3: Counselors – professionals trained to provide advice and support. They may have formal education in psychology or mental health.
a.p4: Peers – people who have been through similar situations. They may also have training. Typically, they are not paid.
a.p5: No matter who you speak to, everyone working at a helpline is trained to listen and support you.
a.p6: When searching for a helpline, you can filter by the type of support you are looking for.

a.p1: Many people don’t know what to say when they call for help. It can be hard to know where to start when you're already feeling overwhelmed.
a.p3: Try practicing what you want to say or writing down a few points to talk about.
a.p4: Here are some phrases that might help:
a.p5: Things have been hard lately because...
a.p7: I’m dealing with [feeling or situation] right now, and...
a.p8: There’s no wrong way to say it
a.p9: The person on the other end is there for you. They want to hear your story and understand what you're going through. You can share as much or as little as you feel comfortable with—no pressure.

a.p1: Helplines are a safe, non-judgmental space for immediate emotional support and information.
a.p3: You can contact a helpline no matter how big or small your issue feels. You don’t have to be in crisis to deserve support—the person on the line will listen and work with you to figure out next steps.
a.p5: If you're in a crisis and need immediate help, the helpline will support you in staying calm and safe. They may ask questions to understand whether you're thinking about self-harm, and help you create a plan to stay safe in that moment.
a.p7: Some helplines specialize in certain types of support or specific groups of people.
a.p8: For example, LGBTQ+ callers may feel more comfortable talking to a helpline trained in those experiences.
a.p9: Helplines are categorized by topic and specialty, so it will be clear what kind of support they provide and who they serve.

a.p1: Many people feel this way. Most helplines are not just for big problems. They're here for anyone who needs someone to talk to.
a.p2: There are also ‘warm lines’—helplines specifically for conversation. These are often run by people who’ve been through tough times themselves.
a.p3: You can find warm lines by using the specialty filter in your helpline search.

a.p1: Many helplines offer services by text, WhatsApp, or online chat. When you search for a helpline, you’ll see the types of contact each one offers.
a.p2: Some people find texting less formal and more private, which can make it easier to open up.

a.p1: Some people fear that the police will be contacted if they ask for help. That fear can be overwhelming.
a.p2: Most helplines are committed to keeping your information private unless they believe that you or someone else is in immediate danger.
a.p3: If you have suicidal thoughts, helplines will work with you to stay safe and won’t involve the police unless you're actively planning to harm yourself or others and no plan can be made to stay safe.
a.p4: You can ask about a helpline’s confidentiality policy before sharing details about your situation.

title-7.q: What if my thoughts are too intense?

a.p1: When your thoughts are intense, you might feel like it's too hard to talk about them. You might worry about how someone will react.
a.p2: Helpline staff are trained to listen. They know how to support people going through what you are experiencing.
a.p3: They won’t judge you. They’ll help you figure out what to do next in a way that works for you.

title-8.q: What if I don't trust professionals?

a.p1: While professional support can be very helpful, we understand it’s not the right fit for everyone.
a.p3: Volunteers – most helplines are staffed by volunteers who want to support people going through tough times.
a.p4: Peers – some helplines connect you with people who have gone through similar challenges.
a.p5: Warm lines – support lines where everyone on the other end has experienced mental health struggles themselves.
a.p6: When you search for a helpline, you can filter by these options to find the kind of support you're most comfortable with.

CountryCard.title: What would you like help with?

notFound.title: Resource not found
notFound.description1: We looked high and low, but couldn’t find the content you’re looking for.

description2.part1: If you’re in emotional distress and want to talk to someone, search by country and topic
description2.part2: . If you're not ready to talk, here are some other options:

options.videosDesc: on coping with tough emotions (via Now Matters Now)

content.p1: ThroughLine Limited (we, us, our), is a company based in New Zealand. Our primary goal is to support people experiencing an emotional crisis throughout the world.
content.p2: In the provision of our Services, we endeavour to comply with the New Zealand Privacy Act 1993 (Act) and the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) when dealing with personally identifiable information.
content.p3: This policy sets out how we will collect, use, disclose and protect your personally identifiable information for each of our Services. It also sets out how you can get access to or request a correction of the personally identifiable information we hold about you.
content.p4: This policy does not limit or exclude any of your rights under the Act or the GDPR. If you wish to seek further information on the Act, see lllink, and for more information on the GDPR, please see lllink.

content.p1: We may change this policy by uploading a revised policy onto our Websites. The change will apply from the date that we upload the revised policy.

PII.definition: means information that could be used on its own to directly identify, contact, or precisely locate an individual. This includes:

list.item6: usernames that contain personally identifiable data

PIIExamples.excludes: We interpret Personally Identifiable Information to exclude, for example:

services.definition: Services means https://www.findahelpline.com, partner-branded websites at https://[companyname].findahelpline.com, and the Find A Helpline embeddable widget that provides Find A Helpline on third party websites

websites.definition: means https://www.findahelpline.com and partner-branded websites at https://[companyname].findahelpline.com

you.definition: refers to you, the individual using our Services

collection.title: Who do we collect personally identifiable information from?

content.p1: In the provision of our Services, we only collect Personally Identifiable Information about you when you provide that information to us via a contact form on our Websites.
content.p2: In the provision of our Services to users located in the European Union our basis for collecting and processing the personally identifiable information provided to us is consent under the GDPR. If you are under the relevant legal age at which you can provide consent to the collection of your personal data, then this consent must have been provided by your parent or guardian.
content.p3: Upon giving this consent, you have consented to the collection and use of the personally identifiable information you provide in the ways described in clause 5 of this policy.
content.p4: You are entitled to withdraw this consent at any time. To do so, please contact us by email to llllink.

usePII.title: How do we use your personally identifiable information?

content.p1: In the provision of our Services the Personally Identifiable Information you provide will be used:

list.item1: to engage in and respond to communications with you;
list.item2: to protect and / or enforce our legal rights and interests, including defending any claim;
list.item3: for any other purpose authorised by you or the Act.

useAggregated.title: How do we use aggregated data?

content.p1: In the provision of our Services we collect aggregated data, which does not include personally identifiable information, for analytical purposes. This aggregated data will be used:

list.item1: to provide our Services to you;
list.item2: to share this aggregated and anonymized information with the service providers who are linked on the site; partners who use the embeddable widget or partner-branded website; or with the underlying IT support providers whose system are used in the operation of Find A Helpline;
list.item3: to conduct research and statistical analysis on an anonymised basis;
list.item4: to share aggregated and anonymized versions of this information, for example, in website and customer usage trend reports, and in conjunction with our development processes;
list.item5: to understand generally who the users of Find A Helpline are, how they use our Services, and how we may improve their experience of Find A Helpline in the future;
list.item6: to protect and / or enforce our legal rights and interests, including defending any claim.

retention.title: How long will information collected from Find A Helpline be kept for?

content.p1: We keep the information provided through Find A Helpline until it is no longer necessary for the purposes it was obtained for.

disclosure.title: Disclosure of information to third parties

contentPII.p1: We will only disclose Personally Identifiable Information to third parties in the following circumstances:

listPII.item1: to a person who can require us to supply your personally identifiable information (e.g. a regulatory authority);
listPII.item2: to any other person authorised by the Act or another law (e.g. a law enforcement agency);
listPII.item3: to any other person authorised by you.

contentAggregated.p1: We will only disclose the aggregated information to third parties in the following circumstances:

listAggregated.item1: to any business that supports our services and products, including those service providers linked on the site or to any person that hosts or maintains any underlying IT system or data centre that we use to provide the Services;
listAggregated.item2: to a person who can require us to supply your personally identifiable information (e.g. a regulatory authority);
listAggregated.item3: to any other person authorised by the Act or another law (e.g. a law enforcement agency);
listAggregated.item4: to any other person authorised by you.

disclosure.note: Please note that a business that supports our services and products may be located outside New Zealand. This may mean that the aggregated information collected is held and processed outside New Zealand.

cookies.title: Use of Cookies on Find A Helpline

content.p1: Our Services uses cookies through Google Analytics. We use these cookies to track and analyse non-personally identifiable data to learn more about how Find A Helpline is used. You may disable cookies by changing the settings on your browser, although this may mean that you cannot use all of the features of Find A Helpline.
content.p2: Google Analytics' scripts are incorporated into our Websites. You can find more about Google Analytics' use of cookies here: lllink. We do not and will not assist or permit any third party to pass information to Google that Google could use or recognize as personally identifiable information.
content.p3: Our Websites use the software system reCaptcha when you complete a review of the service or when using our Contact Us form. reCaptcha is governed by Google's policy and terms of service.
content.p4: Our Websites use Hotjar in order to better understand our users’ needs and to optimize our Services and user experience. Hotjar uses cookies and other technologies to collect data on our users’ behavior and their devices. This includes a device's IP address (processed during your session and stored in a de-identified form), device screen size, device type (unique device identifiers), browser information, geographic location (country only), and the preferred language used to display our website. Hotjar stores this information on our behalf in a pseudonymized user profile. Hotjar is contractually forbidden to sell any of the data collected on our behalf.

content.p1: We will take reasonable steps to keep your personally identifiable information obtained through any of our Services safe from loss, unauthorised activity, or other misuse.
content.p2: While we take reasonable steps to maintain secure internet connections, if you provide us with personally identifiable information over the internet, the provision of that information is at your own risk.
content.p3: We may share a link to a third-parties' websites, services or other platform on our Websites, or through any other communication by us to you. In addition, our Services use Google Analytics, HotJar and the reCaptcha software system. These third-party websites, services, platforms and software, may have their own privacy policies relating to the use of your personally identifiable information. We suggest you review the privacy policies of these third parties before you provide personally identifiable information.

rights.title: Accessing and correcting your personally identifiable information

content.p1: If you are a user of our Services located in the European Union, then you have a right under the GDPR to access your personally identifiable information, ask for a correction of, or to erase that information.

If you are a user of our Services located in New Zealand, then subject to certain grounds for refusal set out in the Act, you have the right to access your readily retrievable personally identifiable information that we hold and to request a correction to your personally identifiable information. Before you exercise this right, we will need evidence to confirm that you are the individual to whom the personally identifiable information relates. In respect of a request for correction, if we think the correction is reasonable and we are reasonably able to change the personally identifiable information, we will make the correction as soon as reasonably possible. If we do not make the correction, we will take reasonable steps to note on the personally identifiable information that you requested the correction.

rights.instructions: If you wish to exercise any of the above rights to which you are entitled, email us at privacy@throughlinecare.com. Your email should provide evidence of who you are and set out the details of your request (e.g. the personally identifiable information, or the correction, that you are requesting).
rights.costNote: We may charge you our reasonable costs of providing to you copies of your personally identifiable information or correcting that information.
rights.contact: If you have any questions regarding this privacy policy, please contact us at privacy@throughlinecare.com

about.title: About These Terms
about.p1: These Terms and Conditions of Service ("Terms") apply to your use of the Websites and the Services provided by ThroughLine Limited ("we", "us" or "our"). Prior to accessing and using the Services, you must accept these Terms. By accessing our Services:

points.1: you agree to be party to these Terms;
points.2: you agree and consent to these Terms and being bound by them;
points.3: you agree that these Terms will be in effect from the first time you access the Services and will remain in effect until terminated.

about.p3: We will update and make changes to these Terms from time to time. Please check these Terms frequently to stay up to date with any changes to these Terms. Unless stated otherwise, any change takes effect immediately. By continuing to access and use our Services, you agree to be bound by the changed Terms.
about.p4: These Terms were last updated on 17 June 2024.

useOfServices.title: Use of Services
useOfServices.p1: You may use the Services provided you comply with these Terms. We reserve the right to modify, amend or cease our provision of the Services (or any part of them) to you at any time at our sole discretion.

restrictions.title: Restrictions on Use
restrictions.intro: You must not, without ThroughLine’s prior written permission:

points.1: use the Services for a commercial or business purpose;
points.2: commercially exploit, sell, license or distribute the Services or any data or any products incorporating the results retrieved using the Services;
points.3: extract, disassemble, decompile, reverse engineer, translate, create derivative works or otherwise seek to reveal the operating logic of any part of the Services;
points.4: conduct, facilitate, authorise or permit any text or data mining or web scraping for any purpose in relation to the Services, or information featured in it, including the use of any automated analytical technique or tools such as bots, scrapers, or AI tools;
points.5: use or permit the use of the Services for the purpose of training artificial intelligence technologies to generate text, including technologies that are capable of generating works in the same style as any part of the Services;
points.6: use the Services to derive the source code, underlying ideas, algorithms, structure or organisation, or any similar action, in a manner that facilitates the creation or development of an Application Programming Interface or any functionality of Services.

restrictions.compliance: In respect of your access to and use of the Services you will comply with all applicable laws, rules and regulations. You must not use or permit the use of the Website and the Services in a way that attempts to circumvent, or is otherwise inconsistent with, your obligations in (and anticipated by) these Terms or for any illegal, unlawful or otherwise improper purpose.

externalLinks.title: External Links Disclaimer
externalLinks.p1: The Services contain links to other websites or resources, including phone numbers, SMS and WhatsApp numbers, which we do not control ("External Websites"). Our linking to External Websites does not constitute an endorsement by us. We are simply facilitating your ability to access and seek assistance from third-party service providers. We are providing these links to you as a convenience and you agree that we are not responsible nor liable for the content of any External Websites. Your use of the External Websites is subject to the terms and conditions of use and privacy policies of the External Websites provider.

intellectualProperty.title: Intellectual Property
intellectualProperty.p1: We (and our licensors) own all proprietary and Intellectual Property Rights in the Services.
intellectualProperty.p2: Nothing in these Terms confers on you any right or interest in, licence or permit to use any of the Intellectual Property in the Services or any other Intellectual Property owned by us or any of our third-party licensors or suppliers, other than in accordance with these express Terms.

disclaimers.title: Disclaimers on Information
disclaimers.p1: You agree that the use of the Services is at your sole discretion and risk.
disclaimers.p2: We provide information and access to resources on a general and "as is" basis, without any representations or warranties (express or implied).
disclaimers.p3: You should not use our information as a substitute for professional healthcare, mental health treatment, psychiatric care or therapy. If you are experiencing a medical or psychological emergency, contact local emergency services.
disclaimers.p4: While we periodically review third-party information, we do not guarantee its accuracy and are not liable for reliance on third-party content or helplines.
disclaimers.p5: We do not warrant that the Services are error-free or will satisfy your requirements. To the maximum extent permitted by law, all other warranties and representations are excluded.

liability.title: Liability
liability.p1: To the maximum extent permitted by law, we (including our employees, agents and affiliates) exclude all liability for harm, loss, or damage arising out of your use of the Services.
liability.p2: Your sole remedy is limited to breach of contract. We are not liable for breach of statute, tort (including negligence), or any other legal claim.
liability.p3: Our maximum liability to you under these Terms is limited to $100 in aggregate.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.p1: Please refer to our Privacy Policy here

maintenance.title: Maintenance, Termination and Suspension
maintenance.p1: We may perform scheduled and emergency maintenance, which may make Services inaccessible.
maintenance.p2: We may suspend or terminate your access at our sole discretion if you breach these Terms. You must stop using the Services immediately upon termination.

forceMajeure.title: Force Majeure
forceMajeure.p1: We are not liable for any delay or failure to fulfill our obligations due to events beyond our reasonable control, such as natural disasters, war, epidemic, or civil unrest.

general.title: General
general.p1: If you encounter problems, please notify us at legal@throughlinecare.com.
general.p2: These Terms are governed by New Zealand law and subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the New Zealand courts.
general.p3: If we do not enforce a term, that does not constitute a waiver of that term or any other right.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.intellectualProperty: Intellectual Property includes all rights in patents, trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, databases, and related technologies.
definitions.p1: patents, trademarks, service marks, copyright, registered designs, trade names, domain names, symbols and logos;
definitions.p2: patent applications and applications to register trademarks, service marks and designs; and confidential information, trade secrets and know-how and rights in tools, techniques, computer program code, databases, data inventions, discoveries, developments, trade secrets, information and logical sequences (whether or not reduced to writing or other machine or human readable form).
definitions.services: Services means access and use of our Websites and tools (including widgets or APIs), whether hosted on our domain or partner websites.
definitions.we: We, us or our refers to ThroughLine Limited, including our employees, directors, and contractors.
definitions.websites: Websites includes https://www.throughlinecare.com, https://findahelpline.com, and any partner-branded websites like https://[companyname].findahelpline.com.

organizations.talkto: What can I talk to {name} about?

contact.title: Have a question? Let us know.
contact.text-1: What can we help you with today?

introduction.text-1: It takes a lot of courage to seek emotional and mental health support. Reaching out is the first step to get the support you deserve.
introduction.text-2: If you are experiencing an emotional crisis and want someone to talk to, search for your country and the topic you would like help with here. If you’re not ready to talk, here are some other options:

list.p1: Watch videos about coping with difficult feelings (via Now Matters Now)
list.p2: Make a safety plan (via Vibrant Emotional Health)

success.title: Thank you for your message!
success.p1: We will get back to you as soon as possible.
